thread.section_title: Louisville News, Sports, Business | The Courier-Journal
thread.title: Tributes pour in for #UCCshooting victims

author: courier-journal.com
title: Tributes pour in for #UCCshooting victims
text:
Condolences are pouring in for the victims of the school shooting at Umpqua Community College near Roseburg, Ore., across social media.
The #UCCshooting hashtag was trending nationally as people, including politicians and celebrities, reached out to offer support.
Prayers for the victims, families, students, & faculty at Umpqua Community College, & the community of Roseburg, Oregon.
— Speaker John Boehner (@SpeakerBoehner) October 1, 2015 Another senseless tragedy with more innocent people killed. Our hearts go out to the families. -B
— Bernie Sanders (@SenSanders) October 1, 2015 Horrific news from Umpqua Community College in Roseburg. My heart and prayers are with the victims and their families.
— Senator Jeff Merkley (@SenJeffMerkley) October 1, 2015 My thoughts are with the families and victims of today's tragedy.
— Kate Brown (@OregonGovBrown) October 1, 2015 Horrified by the breaking news out of Umpqua. My deepest sympathies to the victims and families.
— John Garamendi (@RepGaramendi) October 1, 2015 While U.S. has 5% of the world's population, it saw 31% of public mass shootings #UCCShooting
— Jessica Chastain (@jes_chastain) October 1, 2015 So terrible. My thoughts are with all of those at Umpqua Community College. #UCCShooting .
— Katie Couric (@katiecouric) October 1, 2015 Oregonians everywhere want Roseburg to know we're praying for them.
— Ron Wyden (@RonWyden) October 1, 2015 On a plane and learning about the heinous shooting in Oregon. A community’s heart has been tested but will not be broken. #UCCShooting
— Gabrielle Giffords (@GabbyGiffords) October 1, 2015 Thoughts are with the people of Roseburg as we learn of multiple casualties after a mass shooting at Umpqua Community College. #UCCShooting
— Portland Police (@PortlandPolice) October 1, 2015 Praying for Umpqua Community College, the victims, and families impacted by this senseless tragedy.
— Jeb Bush (@JebBush) October 1, 2015 Heartbroken to hear of another shooting. So many lives lost. Thoughts and prayers are with the victims & families. https://t.co/ywU7UC5np2
— George Takei (@GeorgeTakei) October 1, 2015 Prayers for Roseburg and Umpqua Community College. And all the help that @PortlandPolice @PDXFire and your grieving neighbors can provide
— Charlie Hales (@MayorPDX) October 1, 2015 My heart aches for Umqua College in Oregon right now. This story is sadly too familiar these days.
— Lance Bass (@LanceBass) October 1, 2015
